comment: Dr. Gail Scott relies heavily on UTAs to run her classes and grade assignments, often leading to inconsistent and unfair grading. She struggles with technology and shows little empathy, dismissing anxiety as "all in your head." One thing is evident—if you don't brownnose, expect low grades. The class lacks professionalism and support for students.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: She is an amazing professor and cares so much about students success. I've taken her 3 times and I would definitely choose to have her again. Her study sessions are so helpful and she always offers to help you with any problems you may have. 100% take her classes.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: She made it clear from the first day that she intended on making her classes as difficult as possible. The projects and homework are pointless. I studied ALL the information given for tests and still kept failing. Other very good students failed the tests too. I do NOT recommend her and will NEVER take a class of hers again!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Scott is for sure a tougher professor, but at the end of the day, she will let you make up almost everything with slight penalties to your grade. She had let me make up an exam and also two of my homeworks. She has 3 UTAs that are pretty helpful. The tests are basically the homework questions, so as long as you study you are fine!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Scott is passionate about one thing - being right, that's it. Her powerpoints are useless, she doesn't know how to communicate the material (reads from them, doesn't teach material - get ready to teach yourself). Doesn't respect her students. Condescending, unreasonable. Might be academically qualified but she doesn't foster a learning environment.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is a handful and sometimes her UTAs arent helpful. If you know you wont come to class in person don't take her. She is very nit picky about attendance. If you study correctly and read the textbooks the exams arent too hard but be prepared to work for your grade. She can be a bit blunt and annoying at times but overall shes ok.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: i got an email from a former Gail Scott student warning me to drop the class. i should have listened.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Shes a nice lady and all but she grades the LO's pretty harshly and the tests can also be pretty tough. She will get at you if you're on your laptop or phone so make sure to put those away. I like her as a person but her teaching style isn't for me.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I would rather eat sand than retake her class. She's rude, insensitive, and doesn't teach. There are four tests with 50 questions her and the UTA's help you "review," but the review doesn't correlate with the test.

RUNNN!! DON'T TAKE HER!!!! She is very rude and condescending. Makes the class harder than it needs to be. Doesn't even teach the class, you just read from the textbook and her poorly written PowerPoints. Makes assignment instructions very unclear. Trust me, plz just don't take her; UTAs very unhelpful as well!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you want somebody without humanity, compassion, or just human decency this is the professor for you. She is unreasonable and makes tests during the work day so if you work I hope you have PTO that you can use! I have never disliked a professor more than I dislike her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The class itself isn't especially difficult. However, there was a syllabus quiz that a few students forgot to take, and she sent an email to the class calling the students "failures that would never succeed in psychology." She also has a policy where you cannot miss an exam for any reason and says "please do not email with any sad stories :)."

Dr. Scott comes across as rude and condescending in her messages to the class, a little kindness and motivation go a long way. There are many typos and inconsistencies throughout the PowerPoints, assignments, and even the tests. Assignment instructions do not translate well to the online course. Her online class leaves much to be desired.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: She as well as her UTAs are very condescending, rude, hypocritical and disrespectful. I dread going to her class because of the treatment. I regret signing up for her to be my professor. I am very disappointed in her teaching abilities, tone and insulting language. I should have dropped this course. She should be reported to her bosses.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Many people would think she is doing too much and making the class harder than it needs to be, but it's actually very beneficial. Maybe she could calm down on some of the homework, but it is not really a lot it's just what is required for the work that is the problem. Overall she is a great professor with two UTI's that would help if you need it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She states how writing APA papers are important, but she doesn't provide any guidelines for writing one. It's basically trial and error, and she doesn't even provide feedback on what you need to do next time. Her colloquia presentations are biased and unnecessary. Her lectures consists of her telling unrelated stories. Save your GPA & run.

Doesn't give clear instructions for the 3 lenghty assignments given. Notes only skim the surface of what the tests cover. She is not respectful of her students. If you're even 30 seconds late to class, turn around. If you want to learn every bit of material yourself, take this class. 4 tests including final, 3 absences allowed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is an amazing person and her lectures are interesting and funny. When it comes to her test and pop quizzes they are another story. She also doesn't offer tutoring so you have to make sure you make friends with the students in your class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Makes you work for your grade. Print out all PowerPoint lectures for a grade. Attend study sessions, they will help you! Dont be late to class, she will take your name. Tests are very difficult and if you dont study you definitely wont pass. Dont take her if youre looking for and easy A. Lectures are interesting so its not bad to sit through
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Scott is good at what she does. Don't use any technology in her class. She will get you. You have to print out all PowerPoints and she expects a binder just for her class. She literally gives you what to study for the test, just study. You will do engaging group assignments in class and also will have a colloquium (you teach the class)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't get me wrong, she's a wonderful person. She's very educated in her field and the lectures are entertaining and interesting. But she's a very strict teacher and grader.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: This class is extremely hard and only take if you are a psyc major not for an easy A. Attendance is mandatory and fill in the blank powerpoint lectures. No phones or laptops. 489 total points, 400 for the 3 tests and final (100 points each), 35 points for online sona assignment, 20 points for homework, 15 for pop-quizzes, and 14 for pre/post test.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hard class with a lot of material to study, very test heavy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Class is mandatory and the doors lock right when class starts. She lectures very heavy and you have to read the textbook & understand lectures to comprehend the material. She randomly gives out homework and if you are not in class you receive a 0. Exams are very hard you need to study for days, you can pass the class if you REALLY try. no slacking
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Scott definitely makes you work for it. Lectures are built around PowerPoints that are posted, but they're fill-in-the-blank. Attendance is crucial, mostly because of the random assignments/HW. The syllabus is the key; always read it before emailing her or the UTAs. This course is really content heavy, so make sure you hit the ground running.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Scott is an amazing mentor and educator. If you're a psychology major, take her. If you're looking for an easy A, she is not for you.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: The tests aren't too hard if you study the learning outcomes of every chapter, but there is a lot to study. The challenging part to her is the 5 question quizzes with 1 or 2 questions from material not yet gone over in class. If you're on your phone you will get called out. She goes off topic a lot and talks about her life a lot.
rating_tags: Respected

comment: Prof Scott is a great woman. She seems inapproachable at first but if you go out of your way to participate in class and do the little things she will notice you. Although, the exams are EXTREMELY difficult. Your first exam is a wake up call. Best advice: GET TO KNOW YOUR UTA's! They are they for you and were my saving grace in this class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: good professor, but a bit too strict for my liking. If you are not a very punctual person, stay clear.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Professor Scott is nice but sassy. She WILL call you out if you are on your phone or if you are late.  GET READY TO STUDY IF YOU WANT TO PASS. She is a GREAT teacher but tests are very hard. GO TO ALL STUDY REVIEWS. Pop quizzes are 5 questions and on Tuesdays before tests. Tests are 50 questions. I learned a lot from her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY
